page.title: 16LIFE IN FARLEY
page.content: There was a small school in Farley at the turn of the century. The children now go mainly to the Faber School, Cotton and,afterwards,to state schools in Cheadle or Cotton and Denstone Colleges.Apart from a few business and professional people Farley is main -ly a farming community and what were small farms twenty years ago,have been bought out by J.C.B.Farms Ltd. The village is surrounded by this estate. There is a daily bus service to Cheadle and Uttoxeter,but there are no public facilities for recreation. Cheadle Sports Centre is the nearest.One third of the population are Catholic and attend St.Wilfred's Church,Cotton.The remainder are mainly Church of England. Because of the proximity of Alton Towers,traffic in the village is heavy. Accommodation is available at 10 pounds for Bed and Breakfast.
